1635380995_1NZLf9ua6XqTiK2SLyJMhN9pZhUVJ.body:
yup. Talk more =D With practice it will come. Find someone who is patient enough, or just many different people.

As a backup plan, there are also movies and audiobooks. Songs won't do much, but if you really try hard (like learning the lyrics, trying to emulate the singer's accent etc..) even that may give at least some results too.

But talking is always better. It's hard to start, but people are surprisingly pleasant with those who really want to learn their language! =D

1637305080_18DQw1RXP4gQcqPcYrxZEPzc55fXA.body:
> [ibudder](#comment_1_18DQw1RXP4gQcqPcYrxZEPzc55fXAv16eQ): i mean i don't technically host anythyng on this network

yes, technically you do host everything you download, that's how P2P networks usually work. Torrent, IPFS, ZeroNet, etc. So if you have legal concerns, use blocklists. Also you can set up your own legal block list) Although you'll have to download, see the "bad" content, delete it, and update the blocklist.

> [ibudder](#comment_2_18DQw1RXP4gQcqPcYrxZEPzc55fXAv16eQ): i have legit privacy concerns

as for that, if you didn't set "use only tor" for connections, your IP will be visible as some who's using ZeroNet in general, not sites/files in particular, as far as I know.
